issue.title: Simplify the process of using gazebo as a library even more

content.raw:
The parameters in setupServer() or setupClient() are only used by the system plugins. In other words, the system plugin is the only one that will understand the parameters. So, there are no expectations for the parameters.

Is there any reason to overload setupServer and setupClient instead of using the current signature? You can always convert your std::vector<std::string> to `char**` and `int`.
content.html:
The parameters in setupServer() or setupClient() are only used by the system plugins. In other words, the system plugin is the only one that will understand the parameters. So, there are no expectations for the parameters.

Is there any reason to overload setupServer and setupClient instead of using the current signature? You can always convert your std::vector<std::string> to char** and int.
